metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22719 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A carefully crafted request body can cause a read to a random memory area which could cause the process to crash. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and earlier.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22719` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.22
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.22').
